column4: so... I'm looking to "break into" the linux world (this is my first time on IRC even).  Kinda tired of being locked into M$ developer role... is Ubuntu a good place to start?
we're biased, of course it is
Ubuntu is designed to be very friendly for new users, but usable for anyone, even experts
set up a dual boot, XP & Ubuntu, and go for it.
not really, a lot of the underlying stuff is similar/identical across distros.
the differences for UI stuff will be Gnome vs KDE vs XFCE etc
thanx... I have so much aprehension... not that I don't think I *can* do it, but more that.. well... it gets intimidating
ya, been there, done that, got over it. Best of luck, have fun. :)
haha, thanx
six years in Windows IT, though, right? Not the same animal, except for the basic hardware.

I know, but 6 years with Windows and I'm thinking "I can do that" and then I think to try something new... it's tough getting used to being at the bottom again (not that I was on the top, but I wasn't on the bottom either)
Windows "power users" often have a harder time getting used to Ubuntu/Linux/etc than ppl who just want "browsing & email" to work...
I don't know how "Power" of a windows user I am... but I *like* to think I'm fairly good at picking up new concepts... I guess I'm going to find out pretty soon...
burn a LiveCD before you nuke your current box, make sure it works, you'll always have a working OS that way
sounds good to me
or just set up a dualboot with whatever is on the box currently
LiveCD is maybe best option for now... it's like a trial, right?
yes, but there's an option to install right from the LiveCD, which is very cool.
cool, that may be the best way to go for now.
this way I have a chance to learn something before I have to tell my wife what to do ;)
sounds like a plan
